name: Florissant Fossil Beds National Monument
description: Beneath a grassy mountain valley in central Colorado lies one of the richest and most diverse fossil deposits in the world. Petrified redwood stumps up to 14 feet wide and thousands of detailed fossils of insects and plants reveal the story of a very different, prehistoric Colorado.
shortDescription: Beneath a grassy mountain valley in central Colorado lies one of the richest and most diverse fossil deposits in the world. Petrified redwood stumps up to 14 feet wide and thousands of detailed fossil...

operatingHours.description:
Winter hours begin in November, with the Visitor Center open five days a week, Wednesday through Sunday. On Mondays and Tuesdays, the Visitor Center parking lot, restrooms, and trails remain accessible. 

The Visitor Center parking lot gate is locked daily at 4:30 PM. 

Be sure to park at the Hornbek Homestead if you think your hike may run late - this lot is open 24 hours a day as a designated Dark Sky viewing area.

fees.title: Entrance - Per Person
fees.description:
$10 per adult (age 16 or older). Admission is good for 7 days. Children ages 15 or under are admitted free. Fee covers entrance to all areas of the park including visitor center exhibits, film, outdoor exhibit area, hiking trails, picnic areas, Hornbek Homestead, self-guided tours, and ranger programs.

Pay ahead of your visit at https://www.recreation.gov/sitepass/2683.

climate.weatherDescription: Winter months - average high 40 degrees F; average low 5 degrees F; Summer months - average high 75 degrees F; average low 40 degrees F;

images.title: Big Stump
images.caption: Walk the Petrified Trail Loop to see fossil redwood stumps

images.title: Ancient Wasp Fossil
images.caption: Captured 34 million years ago, this ancient wasp and other insects are on display at Florissant Fossil Beds NM.

images.title: Hornbek Homestead Visitors
images.caption: Visitors explore the Hornbek Homestead, built in 1878.

images.title: Junior Rangers
images.caption: Youth of all ages participate in the Junior Rangers program at the Monument.
